content.div:
It looks like the third time's the charm for Jennifer Garner and Ben Affleck. The couple of seven years welcomed their first son in Santa Monica, Calif., reports People. The baby boy joins sisters Violet, 6, and Seraphina, 3.

"We are happy to announce on February 27, Jennifer gave birth to a healthy baby boy, Samuel Garner Affleck," Affleck posted on his Facebook page.

Affleck has previously commented on being outnumbered by women the three-to-one in his household, but on a recent appearance on The Tonight Show, Garner said she wasnâ€™t sure her husband was hoping for a boy.

"At first, I think, I really thought so," she said. "And then he kind of said, 'Well, we have girls. We know how to do girls. My girls love me. I'm the big guy in the house.' So, now I'm not sure."

Though the couple refused to comment on the sex of their child before the birth, Garner told Ellen Degeneres, "It would be so weird to have a boy."

Garner and Affleck wed in 2005.

link.Abstract: Do babies like sweater capes? How about salt-water taffy? Oprah Winfrey would make an awesome godmother, but she's not Blue Ivy's.

link.Abstract: Jay-Z and Kanye West wrapped their Watch the Throne tour in Vancouver Dec. 17 and 18. For the final concert's closing number, they performed the single "N*ggas in Paris" 11 times.
